fields.headline: Have a midsummer night's dream
fields.bodyText: How are you celebrating midsummer night this year? How about joining in an all night celebration in London's Battersea Park? LIFT festival have come up with what promises to be an unforgettable way of spending midsummer night, June 21. At 12 midnight the Cambodian Shadow Puppet Theatre Sovanna Phum will be performing by firelight and to the sounds of a traditional Khmer orchestra. Then, at 1am, you can help artist Anne Bean create a collaborative light poem. From 3.30am, Connecting Voices, singers from the Guildhall Connect Programme, will be on hand to prepare you for a welcoming of the dawn (at 4.43am). The event ends with the Reverend Nagase of the London Peace Pagoda leading a ceremony to welcome the dawn. This will all be happening at Battersea park, near the Peace Pagoda. Tickets for the entire event are £5 (although entry after 1am is free), and we have five pairs of tickets to give away if you fancy having a truly memorable midsummer night. If you would like a ticket, email arts.competitions@guardianunlimited.co.uk with Midsummer Night in the subject line. Winners will be contacted by 6pm on Wednesday 18 June. More details about the event at liftfest.org.
